name: Liberia
description: Liberia, officially the Republic of Liberia, is a West African nation bordered by Sierra Leone to the northwest, Côte d'Ivoire to the northeast, and the Atlantic Ocean to the west.  It’s known as the 'Rubber City' due to its historical significance in rubber production and boasts a rich, albeit often turbulent, history shaped by its connection to the American Colonization Society.  The country is characterized by diverse landscapes, including coastal plains, rolling hills, and dense rainforests, offering a unique blend of natural beauty and cultural heritage.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital and largest city of Liberia.
quickFacts.detail: Monrovia is situated on Bushrod Island and is a vibrant hub of commerce, culture, and government.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Liberia's population is predominantly comprised of indigenous Liberians and descendants of freed American slaves.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is relatively low, contributing to a rural character in many areas.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: English is the official language, a legacy of its colonial past.
quickFacts.detail: However, numerous indigenous languages are also spoken throughout the country.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Liberian Dollar is pegged to the United States Dollar.
quickFacts.detail: The US Dollar is widely accepted and used in commerce.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Liberia's economy is largely dependent on agriculture and natural resources.
quickFacts.detail: Recent years have seen significant economic challenges due to political instability and the Ebola outbreak.

climateData.title: Climate of Liberia
climateData.description: Liberia experiences a tropical rainforest climate, characterized by high temperatures and humidity year-round. Rainfall is abundant, particularly during the rainy season.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season brings lower rainfall and slightly cooler temperatures. It's a popular time for wildlife viewing and exploring the interior.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Rainy Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The rainy season is characterized by heavy rainfall and high humidity. Rivers swell, and travel can be challenging.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Harmattan Winds
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The Harmattan wind, originating from the Sahara Desert, brings dry, dusty air and reduced visibility.

naturalWonders.name: Sapo National Park
naturalWonders.description: Sapo National Park is Liberia’s largest and most important protected area, a vital stronghold for West Africa’s endangered species. It’s a pristine rainforest teeming with diverse flora and fauna, including chimpanzees, forest elephants, and various primate species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park encompasses a vast area of primary rainforest, offering unparalleled opportunities for wildlife observation and research.  Its rugged terrain and dense vegetation present a significant challenge for exploration, requiring experienced guides and careful planning.

naturalWonders.name: Tinney Island Falls
naturalWonders.description: Tinney Island Falls is a stunning series of waterfalls cascading down a rocky cliff face into a refreshing pool. It’s a popular destination for swimming and enjoying the natural beauty of the region.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located in the Bassa Plateau region, the falls are surrounded by lush vegetation and offer a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle of daily life. The surrounding area is also home to a variety of bird species.

ecosystemData.title: Liberia's Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Liberia’s ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from dense rainforests to coastal plains and savanna grasslands. The country is a biodiversity hotspot, harboring a significant number of endemic species.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forest Ecosystem
biodiversityCategories.description: Liberia’s rainforests cover approximately 50% of the country and are home to a vast array of plant and animal life.

statistics.details: A significant proportion are endemic to Liberia.
Many species are found nowhere else on Earth.

notableSpecies.name: Western Lowland Gorilla
notableSpecies.significance: A key indicator of rainforest health.

notableSpecies.name: Red Colobus Monkey
notableSpecies.significance: A flagship species for conservation efforts.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Ecosystem
biodiversityCategories.description: Liberia’s coastline is characterized by mangrove forests, sandy beaches, and coral reefs.

statistics.details: Crucial for coastal protection and fisheries.
Threatened by pollution and climate change.

notableSpecies.name: Leatherback Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: A vital part of the coastal ecosystem.

activities.title: Activities in Liberia
activities.description: Liberia offers a range of outdoor activities, from wildlife safaris to river cruises and hiking adventures.  However, travel can be challenging due to infrastructure limitations and security concerns.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Liberia’s diverse landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Sapo National Park Trek
activities.description: A challenging trek through the heart of Sapo National Park, offering opportunities to spot wildlife.
activities.requirements: Hiking boots, insect repellent, water bottle, local guide

activities.name: Bassa Plateau Hike
activities.description: A scenic hike through the Bassa Plateau, offering stunning views of the surrounding countryside.

activityCategories.name: Wildlife Safaris
activityCategories.description: Experience Liberia’s incredible wildlife in its natural habitat.

activities.name: Sapo National Park Safari
activities.description: A guided safari through Sapo National Park, focusing on wildlife viewing.

activities.name: St. Elizabeth River Cruise
activities.description: A relaxing cruise along the St. Elizabeth River, offering opportunities to spot wildlife and enjoy the scenery.
